segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so high to reach the cookie jar, and that stool looks ready to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, like it’s the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything looks outside, while inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge, and she’s still polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone is going to slip or fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open window lets in so much light, making the mess inside even more obvious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on his tiptoes, and the stool is wobbling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost hear the water splashing onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just waiting to turn into a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
